description: This course explores topics in the history of Africa, Asia, or Latin America, designed to emphasize active skills of critical reading, textual and contextual analysis, historiographical argument, and historical writing. Recent topics have included "American Empire: A Cultural History of US-Latin America Relations" and "Imperialism and Nationalism in Southeast Asia." Primarily for history majors; others by permission of instructor. Offered periodically.
name: Sem: Crime/Punishment East Asia
notes: WRI was recently added to this course.
title: Major Seminar: Histories of Africa, Asia, and Latin America
